The Neogene Period (23-2.6 million years ago) saw continued deposition of sedimentary rocks, including the formation of the Chicxulub impact crater, which is believed to have caused the extinction of the dinosaurs. During the Quaternary Period (2.6 million years ago to present), the area experienced glaciation and sea level fluctuations, resulting in the deposition of more sedimentary rocks and the formation of coastal features such as barrier islands and estuaries.
